snippet: An online ad by Roland Sledge’s campaign to join the Texas Railroad Commission has drawn attention for riffing on an old — and colorful — Will Rogers quote.
abstract: Houston energy lawyer Roland Sledge produces a campaign advertisement that portrays a man urinating on an electric fence; the ad, part of Sledge's run for a seat on the Texas Railroad Commission, is intended to mock politicians who lack common sense. Photo (M)2
lead_paragraph: HOUSTON -- Texas politics has never been for the fainthearted. A new Internet ad by an underdog Republican running for a seat on a powerful state commission proves it may not be for the tactful, either. In the ad, Roland Sledge, a 66-year-old Houston energy lawyer, stares into a camera while standing in an Austin pasture and says what no other candidate for public office in Texas has ever said: ''Isn't it about time we elected political leaders that have sense enough not to pee on electric fences?''

headline.main: Nature's Call Draws Views For a Texan's Political Ad
